records.location_details: Five migrants were detected by Frontex staff in Bulgaria, close to the Serbian border. They alleged being apprehended in Serbia, having their belongings taken/destroyed, and being forced back to Bulgaria.
records.where_clear: Near the Serbian-Bulgarian border, on the Bulgarian side.
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location details are redacted, but the general area of the Serbian-Bulgarian border is consistently mentioned.

possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 1 of Protocol No 1 to the European Convention on Human Rights
Article 4 Protocol No 4 to the European Convention on Human Rights

records.context_note: Frontex operational staff in Bulgaria detected five migrants near the Serbian border. The migrants, including three alleged minors, claimed Serbian border police destroyed their documents, took valuables, and forced them back to Bulgaria. They were exhausted, and one had no shoes. The Fundamental Rights Office could not independently corroborate the allegations but found it plausible that the incident occurred as described.
records.evidence_quote: The migrants alleged that Serbian border police officers destroyed their documents, took all their valuables, and forced them to cross back to Bulgaria earlier the same day. The migrants were exhausted, one of them had no shoes on.
